question: Read the following passage carefully and answer the questions given below in your own words:
prashna: निम्नलिखित गद्यांश को ध्यानपूर्वक पढ़ें और नीचे दिए गए प्रश्नों के उत्तर अपने शब्दों में दें:
context: In developing countries, the girls lag behind the boys in education. A large number of them do not go to school. Even when they are enrolled the burden of domestic chores stands in the way of their education progress. The single most important factors in their poor performance is the time and strain imposed by girl child's work load. Close behind poverty, follows tradition. And perhaps the strongest tradition of all is the idea that sons should be educated because they will be the bread winners of their own future families, and supporters of their aging parents. A girl's work, though it may be longer and harder, is considered less likely to bring monetary income. In culture where marriage means that a daughter becomes the part of her husband's family, the incentive to educate girls is weaker still.

sub_questions.1: Why do people prefer to educate boys to girls?
sub_questions.2: Girls are paid less though their work may be harder. What attitude of society does it show?
sub_questions.3: Why is the incentive to educate girls less in culture where the daughter becomes the part of her husband's family after marriage?
sub_questions.4: Which word in the passage means the following? Not keep up with/go to slow.

anuprashna.1: लोग लड़कियों की तुलना में लड़कों को शिक्षित करना क्यों पसंद करते हैं?
anuprashna.2: लड़कियों को कम भुगतान किया जाता है भले ही उनका काम कठिन हो। यह समाज के किस दृष्टिकोण को दर्शाता है?
anuprashna.3: उस संस्कृति में लड़कियों को शिक्षित करने का प्रोत्साहन कम क्यों है जहाँ शादी के बाद बेटी अपने पति के परिवार का हिस्सा बन जाती है?
anuprashna.4: गद्यांश में किस शब्द का अर्थ निम्नलिखित है? साथ न चल पाना/धीमे चलना।

question: Read the following passage carefully and answer the questions given below in your own words:
prashna: निम्नलिखित गद्यांश को ध्यानपूर्वक पढ़ें और नीचे दिए गए प्रश्नों के उत्तर अपने शब्दों में दें:
context: If you wish to be a writer, you must learn to develop your own point of view. All good writers make us see things in a different light. You may be writing about the same thing as your classmate, but your presentation must reflect your personality and individuality. There are so many interesting subjects you can write about in different forms but here we will try to attempt writing short stories. There is a good market for the following types: The humorous stories, the adventurous stories, the domestic stories, the mysteries and stories related to animals and strange experiences. Don't worry if the story turns out to be very short. Some of the very good stories are quite very short. Be very careful about the end of the story. So think of a plot-make points on how the story will progress and pen it down.

sub_questions.1: What does a reader do to be a writer?
sub_questions.2: What things must a successful writer keep in mind while writing a story?
sub_questions.3: Write any two types of stories which people like to read.
sub_questions.4: Find a phrase in the passage which means the same ‘to write’.

anuprashna.1: लेखक बनने के लिए पाठक को क्या करना चाहिए?
anuprashna.2: एक सफल लेखक को कहानी लिखते समय किन बातों का ध्यान रखना चाहिए?
anuprashna.3: किन्हीं दो प्रकार की कहानियों के नाम लिखिए जिन्हें लोग पढ़ना पसंद करते हैं।
anuprashna.4: गद्यांश में वह वाक्यांश ढूँढ़िए जिसका अर्थ 'लिखना' (to write) के समान हो।

question: Write a letter to your friend, telling him the measures your school has taken to preserve ecology in the locality.
prashna: अपने मित्र को एक पत्र लिखें, जिसमें उसे उन उपायों के बारे में बताएं जो आपके स्कूल ने इलाके में पारिस्थितिकी (ecology) को संरक्षित करने के लिए किए हैं।

question: Write a letter to your elder brother expressing your impression of Hindi film which you have seen recently.
prashna: अपने बड़े भाई को एक पत्र लिखकर हाल ही में देखी गई हिंदी फिल्म के बारे में अपना अनुभव व्यक्त करें।

question: Write a paragraph on any one of the following in about 60 words: (i) Importance of Television (ii) Bliss of Solitude (iii) Female education (iv) Your School Library
prashna: निम्नलिखित में से किसी एक पर लगभग 60 शब्दों में एक अनुच्छेद लिखें: (i) टेलीविजन का महत्व (ii) एकांत का आनंद (iii) महिला शिक्षा (iv) आपके स्कूल का पुस्तकालय

question: You are Vinay/Sunita, the Secretary of the drama society of your school. Write a notice to invite the students to watch a play in Hindi. Mention the title of the play, its writer, the venue and the time.
prashna: आप अपने स्कूल की ड्रामा सोसाइटी के सचिव विनय/सुनीता हैं। छात्रों को हिंदी में नाटक देखने के लिए आमंत्रित करने हेतु एक सूचना (notice) लिखें। नाटक का शीर्षक, उसके लेखक, स्थान और समय का उल्लेख करें।

question: If you move from one culture to another culture you may find variation in custom, food habits, dress code and activities. Write a short paragraph on culture variation that you observe in the society.
prashna: यदि आप एक संस्कृति से दूसरी संस्कृति में जाते हैं तो आपको रीति-रिवाजों, खान-पान की आदतों, पहनावे और गतिविधियों में भिन्नता मिल सकती है। समाज में आपके द्वारा देखी जाने वाली सांस्कृतिक भिन्नता पर एक संक्षिप्त अनुच्छेद लिखें।

question: Answer any one of the following in about 80 words:

question: Read carefully the stanza given below and answer the questions that follow:

Whose herd with milk, whose field with bread.
